name: Zulay Metal 2-In-1 Lemon Squeezer Manual - Sturdy, Max Extraction Hand Juicer Lemon Squeezer Gets Every Last Drop - Easy to Clean Manual Citrus Juicer - Easy-to-Use Lemon Juicer Squeezer - Gray/Lime
about_this_item: SQUEEZE OUT EVERY DROP OF JUICE: Our 2-in-1 lemon squeezer won‚Äôt waste a single drop from your favorite fruit! We have designed this lime juicer to be easy on hands. Watch limes, lemons, and small oranges beg for mercy, even with a soft squeeze. The holes at the bottom of the citrus juicer serve as a seed filter to prevent the pulp and seeds from getting in your way.

SAVE TIME AND SPACE: You no longer have to worry about power, replacing batteries, or even bulky juicers crowding your kitchen counter with our easy-to-store citrus squeezer. Quench your thirst by making a citrusy lemonade or margarita in seconds; simply place a half cut lemon/lime in the bowl and watch the citrusy goodness add flavor to your drink or meal.

STURDY AND HEAVY DUTY BOWLS: This durable manual juicer is made from aluminum and is finished off with a food-grade coating, making it a perfect addition to your cocktail accessories for years to come. The ergonomic handle makes the lemon lime squeezer super comfortable for even kids to use.

CLEANS IN SECONDS: After adding a tangy flavor to your recipe, simply toss the citrus juicer in the dishwasher for a quick clean up. Our juice press can also be effortlessly cleaned by running it under water.
HASSLE-FREE, ZULAY GUARANTEE: We love and take pride in our lemon and lime squeezer and back it up with a lifetime guarantee. If there are ever any issues, just contact us, and we will make it right.

title: Great citrus squeezer.
content: I was shopping for a citrus squeezer because I thought I had one, but didn‚Äôt. Doing my search on Amazon for a squeezer this one stood out. It had so many positive reviews. I thought I‚Äôd give it a shot. I am so glad I did. It does the job amazingly I got every drop of juice out of my limes, it‚Äôs dishwasher safe, which I like  and it‚Äôs well built. I think it will last a lifetime. I highly recommend.

title: Lemon Squeezer - Easy to use, no seeds in the juice, easy to clean-up
content: The Zulay Metal 2-in-1 Lemon juice extractor is a great design concept.  I first used it at my daughter's home, and the light bulb clicked that this is a fundamentally different (and better) way to juice lemons, limes and oranges. The first step is to cut the lemon in half (standard practice).  However, the next step for the user is to slice the bottom off the half lemon.  Then the user puts the trimmed lemon into the cup on the Lemon squeezer and squeeze.  The juice comes out of the bottom of the Zulay squeezer, and the seeds and plup stay in the lemon carcass.  If you wish, you can trim a bit of the pulp and put it into your juice container.  The beauty of the design is that you do not have to pick the the seeds out of the extracted juice or out of the pulp.  Clean-up is very easy.  Throw away the lemon carcasses and rinse the Zulay unit with water.  There are two cup sizes built into the unit, so that the unit can handle large and small lemons and small limes.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024

title: Lemon/lime juice squeezer
content: When you see those bowl-shaped sections, it may seem counterintuitive but you actually place the fruit in face-down so the squeezed juice can flow easily through the holes. Ideally, pressing would cause the rind to take the shape of the bowl, completely inverting it and making the entire surface squeezable, but that doesn't quite happen. I use the Zulay squeezer first because it does cut down on the workload and changes it from totally requiring the use of the small finger and thumb joints.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024

title: Love it
content: I used fresh lemon juice in my tea and water regularly. I can squeeze all the lemons I need to keep me in lemon juice for the week with this tool. Cut your lemon in half at the circumfrance (the short way around, not the long way) place it in the device cut side down and squeeze. I like to readjust the lemon after the first squeeze and give it another squeeze. I don't have any issue with the tool, but the lemons I get (all the way up in the far reaches of New England) are less than great sometimes and some seem to be more rind and peel than actual fruit. However, this tool can get some juice out of them. If you have an extremely large lemon, you might have to quarter your lemons to fit the tool, but I have had to do that maybe once or twice. A tiny seed may escape into your juice from time to time, but it's really no inconvenience. Since the lemons I get are shipped from afar I assume they are waxed on the outside, so your tool will build up a bit of wax and citrus oily residue. A scrubber sponge and some hot water does the trick. I've run it through the top rack of the dishwasher before, but the residue stayed. Comes off easier when you hand wash it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024

title: The juicer of juicers!
content: I wanted lemonade without the additives, juice at a much lower expense. I needed vitamin c. So I bought lemons, halved them, popped a fork in, swished and squashed the pulp, back and forth until the juice came out, along with a lot of seeds, and getting juice on my fingers and sometimes my clothes. Used the same fork to fish the seeds out of the glass and left the rind in the glass (wanted to use all the pulp). It was a messy job. Had to wash my hands and fork.
